rComments: My God, she is an annoying and a horrible professor I`ve ever seen. The tests/exams are NOTHING related to the course content!! I had a terrible experience with soc100!
Definitely the worst prof at UTM! :S test questions were mostly history questions where u had to memorise tons of dates which have to do nothing with sociology.

This is the worst prof i ever had, she pretty much made me question my pursuit of the rest of my sociology degree. Evaluations were similar to my gr 11 history questions. 50% of the exam was core material, the rest was history (important dates, prime ministers at the time etc..) ....

SUCH an easy class. She's also a really nice person as well, when she miscalculated my grade because my exam wasn't found she did everything in her power to find it. I never went to lecture because she just read from the book and still received an A

I took this class when she first started teaching it at UTM.  Apparently, things are different now, but her tests were easier before.  Two MC tests worth 30% and 40% for the exam.  The MC was just common sense definitions. I never read the textbook, stopped going to lecture the last couple months (boring) and still got a B.
Lecturer is approachable and easy to talk to. Tests are difficult. She engages students with Utube videos and is passionate about sociology. Read and study the lecture notes
Great lecturer! Others whing because they didn't study for the assessments. Earlier comments about this professor are totally unfair. She was great and the course was very interesting- Just study!

I'll make this brief. Prof doesn't put the lecture slides online and talks at the speed of lightening during class. Get the past lecture slides if you can manage since they're exactly the same. Tests are okay. Just study her lecture slides like crazy and that's it. Don't bother opening the textbook. Lastly, she's a good person but a bad teacher.

This course was..it started off well then she messed everyone up just to push the class average down as opposed to actually teaching sociology. She wasn't clear most of the time,attendance isn't mandatory because all she does is read off slides which you can get from anyone, & the reading wasn't necessary because her slides were notes from the book

Was not helpful, did not take student's complaints or suggestions when the class thought that the tests were unfair. Read off the slides and give examples straight from the textbook. Nothing she covered in class or the textbook was tested, only irrelevant details. I have no interest in taking future sociology courses because of her.

This course was way too dependent on the textbook. She couldn't explain concepts clearly because all she did was read off slides in monotone with the occasional pathetic attempt at humour :/ Tests and exams were based on small details rather than main theories so take soc100 with anyone else if possible! Green was far more engaging!
dont know how to teach
Her tests and exam questions were nothing relevant to the course. There were no point of reading the textbook. She killed my interest in Sociology.
Terrible Prof no words can explain the unfairness of this course.

exam and 3rd test had completely irrelevant questions to the subject of sociology. gave unreasonable amount of time for her heavy-duty tests. half of the textbook wasn't covered in lectures, had to memorize every single word, date, and number to do reasonably well.
Decent prof but lectures are not really prepared. Contrary to what many are saying, I think she is reasonably fair with tests/examinations

Tests contained material irrelevant to sociology. Not even in upper year bio do we have to memorize the dates and irrelevant information. She does. She expects you to memorize every word, number, and period in all the readings. Terrible prof. Doesn't care about her students at all
exams and test totally irrelevant, to the course. Tries to hard and messes up things up more. NEEEDS to be removed from teaching this subject, absolutely useless!!
This Profs exam and tests were really irrelevant to the course. The topics were not even covered in class, it looked more like a history+poltics exam to me.
I had this prof last year and she was really really easy. Apparently she has gotten harder because her class average was too high...
Many test questions (especially on exam) were irrelevant and extremely specific....shifts focus away from sociology a lot of the time

Very unorganized. Tries to cram too much into one lecture. Was ok in the beginning but went down hill fast! her tests are WAY to long for the allotted time and the essay making was ridiculously hard (average was a 50!). wouldn't suggest taking this if ur GPA cant afford a hard hit!

If you had her when she was just starting to teach SOC100 she might have been easy, but now she's just horrible. Not very helpful and very unclear about what she expects from you in terms of short answers and essays. I wish I had never taken the course, because despite putting a lot of effort, she grades things too hard for my liking.

Was unorganized with the mark breakdown of the course (100% research group work but 20% was based on presentation appearance ie. move your hands, talk clearly, not much about what you were even saying). Miscalculated my mark and was very condescending when I went in for a recount. Good lectures and helpful when sought out. Not a good experience.
good
she's really good at teaching and is really organized. She lives in Australia though, hopefully she'll come back to teach :)
good.

You either love her or hate her lol...she's kinda anal...if you're late to the lecture hall she gets pissed cuz it distracts her and has tried on many occasions to kick ppl out. Read the txtbk and you'll pass the tests. Know theorists and theories. Download all lec slides off blackboard 1st week cuz ppl stop showing up and she removes them all. =)

AWESOME professor! You can tell that she cares about your progress and wants to relate to you. Professor Casimiro is very strict about the rules, though. Do not be late to her class! Her expectations regarding homework quality are quite reasonable.
